titleStmt.title: A hundreth good pointes of husbandry lately maried vnto a hundreth good poynts of huswifery: newly corrected and amplified with dyuers proper lessons for housholders, as by the table at the latter ende, more plainly may appeare: set foorth by Thomas Tusser Gentle man, seruant to the right honorable Lorde Paget of Beudefert.
titleStmt.author: Tusser, Thomas, 1524?-1580.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Denham?] In ædibus Richardi Tottylli cum priuilegio,

notesStmt.note: Printer's name conjectured by STC; the woodcut title-page border has "HD" in sill.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

person.persName: Henry Denham?] In ædibus Richardi Tottylli
